result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Ronald D Repplinger was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
***Defendant eligible for the MICA / DUAL DIAGNOSIS PROGRAM after serving 3 years of his sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs due during term of extended supervision. Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Pay supervision fees.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to attend Victim Impact Panel
***2/3/2016, Court vacated defendant's previous sentence and scheduled a new sentencing date on 3/15/2016. Defendant eligible for Substance Abuse Program after serving -3- years of his sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Fine/costs due during period of probation. Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-AODA and any counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Pay supervision fees.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ronald D Repplinger in court with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders Ct. 2 dismissed as mute. Court renders sentence.
Sentencing Report from Cedar Creek Family Counseling.   Scanned and forwarded to Branch 1 for review.
Copy for the Court forwarded to branch 1 and copy e-mailed to DA's office and mailed to Atty. Pyzyk.
Sentencing hearing on April 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

State appears by Attorney Jeff Sisley. Defendant Ronald Repplinger appears in court, in custody with Attorney Roger Pyzyk. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant changing plea and pleads guilty to count 1. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court advised the defendant pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until their civil rights have been restored. Court orders pre-sentence investigation. Count 2 not addressed. Court orders matter adjourned for sentencing on April 6, 2015 at 3:00 pm.
Further proceedings on January 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ronald D Repplinger in court with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Pyzyk requests a plea/sentencing date.  Further proceedings scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Arraignment on October 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Ronald D Repplinger in court with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense requests another date for arraignment.

State by ADA Patti Wabitsch.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Dejunco.  Counsel advises the defendant does qualify for public defender representation and that defendant is on a P.O. hold at this time.  State requesting $25,000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $25,000 cash bail w/conditions:  absolute sobriety; no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed; SCRAM Bracelet within 12 hours of posting bail; not to operate m/v.  Counsel requesting status of prelim hrg; waiving timelimits.  Court orders matter adj to 9/16 at 10 am for status of prelim hrg.
